m_DescList: Web crawling is a technology that collects web data through automated programs. The core steps are:
1. Obtain raw HTML code through HTTP requests
2. Use regular expressions to match hyperlinks in HTML
3. Use regular expressions to locate text and data
4. Store cleaned text in databases or file systems
For example, here is a HTML code snippet:
<color=#804422><!DOCTYPE</color> <color=#ee3300>html</color><color=#804422>></color>
<color=#804422><html</color> <color=#ee3300>lang</color>=<color=#3c3cff>"en"</color><color=#804422>></color>
<color=#804422><head></color>
<color=#804422><meta</color> <color=#ee3300>charset</color>=<color=#3c3cff>"UTF-8"</color><color=#804422>></color>
<color=#804422><meta</color> <color=#ee3300>name</color>=<color=#3c3cff>"viewport"</color> <color=#ee3300>content</color>=<color=#3c3cff>"width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"</color>>
<color=#804422><title></color>Document<color=#804422></title></color>
<color=#804422></head></color>
<color=#804422><body></color>
<color=#804422><a</color> <color=#ee3300>href</color>=<color=#3c3cff>"http://127.0.0.1"</color><color=#804422>></</color><color=#804422>a></color>
<color=#804422></body></color>
<color=#804422></html></color>
This HTML code consists of various tags. For example, a body tag can be written as:
<color=#804422><body></color><color=#666666>some code here...</color><color=#804422></body></color>
<color=#804422><body></color> and <color=#804422></body></color> appear in pairs, with child element content written between the tag symbols.
For example, an a tag can be written as:
<color=#804422><a</color> <color=#ee3300>href</color>=<color=#3c3cff>"http://127.0.0.1"</color><color=#804422>></</color><color=#804422>a></color>
The middle part <color=#ee3300>href</color>=<color=#3c3cff>"http://127.0.0.1"</color> serves as the a tag's attribute, indicating the URL the browser will navigate to when clicking this link.
To simplify the problem difficulty, we make the following conventions:
1. Assume input HTML code is syntactically correct, every <color=#804422><a</color><color=#804422>></color> has a corresponding <color=#804422></a</color><color=#804422>></color>
2. Both keywords (<color=#3c3cff>href id class</color> etc.) and tag names (<color=#3c3cff>a div span</color> etc.) use lowercase
3. For 100% of input data, only <color=#3c3cff>"</color> is used, not a mix of <color=#3c3cff>" '</color>
4. Taking the above example, the expected match result is <color=#e06600><a</color> <color=#e06600>href="http://127.0.0.1"></color>
5. For 100% of input data, there are no spaces after <color=#e06600>href</color>
6. Special case: <color=#e06600>href=""</color> If the href content is an empty string, do not match the A tag
Now, we need to match the content of a tag that contains href.
